website_summaries.verdict: Quirks aside, this model is worth a look if you need a navigation system that's made for consumers who drive recreational vehicles.
pros: Offers technology that's designed to help drivers of large vehicles navigate the road
Ideal for RVs, large trucks, and tow trailers
Offers custom routing for the weight of your vehicle
cons: Some navigation inaccuracies have been reported
More expensive than other models on our list

customer_reviews.title: The first time we used the Garmin it took us ...
customer_reviews.text: The first time we used the Garmin it took us to a bridge with a three ton weight limit on Old Stage Road off of Route 903. Luckily we were able to maneuver our 35 foot mobile home out of the predicament we were in!! It obviously cannot be relied on. The second time we used the Garmin it took us to the wrong location. I would not recommend this garmin to anyone. It is a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great RV GPS but double check routes
customer_reviews.text: I love it so far, but you do have to cross check routes. it tried to route me 100 miles around a tunnel that I clearly could fit under. the Heceta tunnel on Oregon 101. the bottom of the arch is 11' 6" but the driving lane is 14' 6" and taller as it goes up the arch.
customer_reviews.author: R. Pope

customer_reviews.title: Wrong directions to the point of dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I am so fed up with being sent on wild-goose chases down city roads not designed for a 45 bus towing a vehicle. I don't know if any other GPS is better, but this one sucks. It is downright dangerous. I also have a 760 model that is no better. I thought that they would have improved the mapping system, but the 770 is no better than the 760 which is bad.
customer_reviews.author: JoeBotts

customer_reviews.title: Valued navigation device
customer_reviews.text: This device has not steered us wrong. We needed to get from VA to Washington DC and every other map and online system wanted us to take the tunnel under the Chesapeake Bay. I was not comfortable doing that in a 40' class A motor home. We drove through the day before in a car on a side trip and it was tight! When I entered our destination in this Garmin, it totally took me a way that I thought might be possible on my trucker map book completely avoiding the tunnel. This GPS makes this nervous navigator enjoy the trip a whole lot more. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DIANE G MILLER

customer_reviews.title: Clear very sharp detail. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: My RV dealer was going to install one very similar for $1,300.00 I told him thanks but no thanks I can do it myself for under $200.00. I can keep an eye on my car I'm towing behind the Class A Motorhome. Flat tires, straps coming loose. An absolute must to prevent damage to your "Toad" I was amazed at the sharp video . Just wired the camera so when I turn on running lights it powers up. Monitor plugs in 12 Volt cigarette lighter and has a push push on off switch. Great value. Easy install.
customer_reviews.author: Lee J Walker

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this product
customer_reviews.text: Sent the product back, all kinds of route issues. One example, I needed to get on an interstate. To get onto the interstate I simply needed to turn left. This thing wanted me to go past the left hand turn, to the next light and do a U-turn. I have it set to avoid U-turns......No this was not some new traffic pattern or road construction that caused this. This is just one of many bugs I found in this thing just in one trip. Avoid this thing or it could get you in a bad situation. I have used several Garmin products without issues so not sure what it up with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not recognize State Parks.
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this twice to date, and so far it has been very accurate. The only thing I dislike about it is that for an GPS touted as an RV special, It does not recognize state parks as addresses, nor was I able to locate it when given the actual published address (street number, city and state). I found that very strange, you would think any public recreation area would be an automatic add to the program. Had to go to Google Earth and find the coordinates to get my route. Not very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra H. Beaudoin

customer_reviews.title: Traffic Info? - Not Exactly
customer_reviews.text: The "T" in the model number means "Traffic". Yes, there are two ways this model can get traffic information, but both require expensive accessories: either a pricey external traffic receiver that should be included with the unit, or a smartphone with a data plan. And no, if you have a source of wi-fi in the vehicle but no smartphone, that won't be enough. It has to connect to an app using Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Flymo

customer_reviews.title: Save your money / buy a road atlas
customer_reviews.text: The pros : Large easy to see screen, good touch screen, friction dash holder worked well. Cons : sent you off the route on to small side roads (when you program it for your size rv rig, ) told you about up coming road curves that were not there, couldn't find alot of state parks, . Did better with google maps on my phone and a road atlas. Not a Happy camper with this purchase, sat on the floor of the truck on the way back from our trip
customer_reviews.author: jim patterson

customer_reviews.title: RV GPS
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to take into consideration your RV dimensions and the fact you are DRIVING an RV, which is a PLUS .... but .... yes, there is a but ... on NUMEROUS OCCASIONS this GPS has routed us WAY OUT OF OUR WAY to our destination AND considering we are driving a rather large RV this is DEFINITELY not good. :((
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Nairn

customer_reviews.title: Junk  didn't even turn it on.  Just sent it back.
customer_reviews.text: What a waste. No input for backup camera, lifetime traffic ONLY when paired to a smartphone??? WTF?!?! If i need a smart phone for traffic then i might as well use the smartphobe for GPS. The whole point of me spending hundreds of dollars on a gps is to have a stand alone unit OTHER than my smartphone. If this pos doesn't work without a smartphone... it is junk. Dont waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Burns

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: It told me to turn left on on the top of a bridge, that I had arrived at Walmart, Walmart was three miles away. It directed me into a residential street that was too small for the motorhome to be able to go down. Twice it has routed me to ferries that I was over the weight limit. One was extremely difficult to turn around. It told me to exit the highway, one then immediately get back on the same highway, at the same exit. Numerous times it has given me incorrect information on a turn. I also have a Garmin in my other vehicle, it is no better. I will no longer buy Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: badge2283

customer_reviews.title: Less Sophisticated than Google Drive
customer_reviews.text: This device gets rave reviews, but it seems far less up-to-date than the Google Drive GPS that's built into our phones. The large screen is nice, but I haven't found anything, yet, that this device does better than our phones. On our first trip using this, it wouldn't accept the street address of our destination - despite having spent a few house updating the software after buying it! My wife, a computer professional, dislikes this unit. But, I am hopeful that the RV-specific features will make me glad I spent the money someday.
customer_reviews.author: P. Dershem

customer_reviews.title: LIke the size easy to read
customer_reviews.text: Still getting use to it. I would have to put in each destination for the next stop rather than the whole trip to get the route I wanted. LIke the size easy to read. It took us downtown in Goshen Ind rather than to the destination I had put in which was the fairgrounds. Some addresses are hard to put in if it is a highway # or route #. Have to find a location nearby with an address.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Bliss

customer_reviews.title: Love this one!
customer_reviews.text: I had the 760 and it went bad, they couldnt fix it without sending it in but fortunately I have bought the extended warranty from amazon, they were quick to pay me so I purchased this 770. This one is such a step above in use than the 760, it routes much better and easier. Touch screen is better than the 760 also.
customer_reviews.author: Tab McBlane

customer_reviews.title: It is a husband and wife best friend. I drive, Garmin is our navigator my wife enjoys the scenery and not having to read a map
customer_reviews.text: Works every time and the auto update is great. This is my 4th or 5th Garmin device, I do not recall how many I have purchased. They all work great and worth the investment to get the newest version. It is a husband and wife best friend. I drive, Garmin is our navigator my wife enjoys the scenery and not having to read an outdated paper map. Life got a whole lot better with Garmin!
customer_reviews.author: Randal DeHart, PMP, QPA

customer_reviews.title: Useful for specific needs only, not useful for general purpose
customer_reviews.text: Some KOA campgrounds not found. Searching for specific address difficult. Set up for finding camping areas not addresses. Selecting between alternate routes lacks detail so not enough information to make a good decision. Does not list alternate route reasoning, i.e. less climbing or higher speed roads.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Balster

customer_reviews.title: Garmin or Garbage / GPS or POS
customer_reviews.text: Garmin garbage. Sending it back! Don’t waste your money or time. The very first trip was a wild goose chase. The directions weren’t even close. Tried to use it for the trip back and it couldn’t even locate my campground. If you’re gonna sell a gps unit a good start might be maps that work and appropriate directions. This pos has neither.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey J. Sales

customer_reviews.title: proper equipment
customer_reviews.text: After opening the parcel I found two power cords one that is powered by the cigarette light in the rv and the other that is to be plugged into a wall socket. The cigarfdette one is 3 ft long but the other one is 12 inches. How am I supposed to plug in with such a short cable? Additionally, when I plug in the short one the Garmin shows the cable cannot support the device charging. Please provide a long enough cable and what am I to do about the warning using the short cable I received?
customer_reviews.author: richard

customer_reviews.title: Outdated technology.
customer_reviews.text: It seems a little primitive technology wise. The firmware was dated 2016. The screen size is good. The power connection is two generations back. As with most devices these days there is no printed instructions, so you have to use another device to figure out how to use it. I was choosing between the Rand McNally RV device and this one. This seems to have all the same short comings I read about in reviews of the RM . It took all night to update the maps through Garmin "Express" on my laptop. They were still missing many local roads in my neighborhood. I should have stuck with Google maps in my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Azlandman

customer_reviews.title: This thing is junk
customer_reviews.text: First time I used this unit it froze while navigating Dallas in the dark. Took my Iphone to work my way out of a pretty precarious neighborhood. Second time it could not find my RV park in Waco in spite of it being 100 yards from freeway. Also couldn’t find the park address. I could whine more but suffice to say. Pass. This thing is junk. Oh, and yes I carefully read the manual, twice actually, and set the unit up accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: MGH of Kodiak

customer_reviews.title: Unit will not charge while driving or plugged into electric
customer_reviews.text: We have used a Garmin GPS for 5 years and have loved it. It was easy to set up, charge and use. We decided to get this RV model since we now travel full-time in a RV. What a waste of time! We spent many hours trying to figure out how to get this thing to even turn on! We had it plugged in while driving for 6+ hours and then we plugged it into an electric outlet in a friend's home for 3 days! Nothing. Totally defective. Totally user unfriendly. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Cousins

customer_reviews.title: Great Device for My RV
customer_reviews.text: I love the navigation and it has guided me accurately every time I have used it. I also have the Garmin wireless backup camera hooked up to it so it helps a lot when I need to use that. It also shows gas stations that I am near, so I have not ever worried about finding one. I also take it inside a day or two before I take the RV on the road and download all the current updates to in from my wifi. I also get notifications from my phone so I don't have to worry about missing text messages or phone calls. It has been well worth my money.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Petry

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust the routes
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our RV. At first it seemed to work correctly and was helpful; but the more I use it the more I hate it. It use to give the distance to and the name of the next turn, but that all ended with a system upgrade. Now it will show a turn on the map, but not give any information regarding it, or sometimes not give the proper roadway name or number. I no longer trust the routes it gives, because I've found too often it will attempt to take me through impossible routes for my RV, even after the latest system and map upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha K. Owen

customer_reviews.title: Garmin RV 770
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace my Garmin Nuvi 5000 that has served me very well over the years. It is fast, very fast to boot up and has great features and functions. Love the larger size screen. I am a Garmin loyalist and stick with them as their technology and map software is simply the best.
customer_reviews.author: R Schafer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't do much more than my Garmin nuvi except tell me about sharp turns and speed limit changes. It also stated that every rest area I pulled into had not been determined to be RV accessible. If it doesn't know that what else is missing 6/28/2019 update: finally got around to updating the (maps). Nebraska changed speed limits from 60 MPH to 65 a couple years ago and was actually hoping the map would update the changes but no such luck. Wish all these companies would stop selling free map updates and call them what they really are " poi updates". I've still to see the actual map change
customer_reviews.author: Ingy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: The bar has been raised much higher for GPS units in the years since Google maps. However if you need a device that can suggest routes based on your length and high that will work with no cell service this will do the job... most of the time. It's not perfect, it did lead us down a road with a low overpass that we would have hit. It's also incorrect when it comes to speed limits once in awhile. I can understand how difficult it must be to keep up to date info on their units. This unit is pretty good overal.
customer_reviews.author: Joel C.

customer_reviews.title: Useless  Would not give it any stars. Should be all ----Minus's
customer_reviews.text: Traveled cross country. Bought it for my RV travel. Wanted to be sure I was on safe roads , with bridge clearances . Could not find maps. Could not direct to rest areas or gas stations. Very disappointing. Had to use Verizon Navigator 3,200 miles. Alot of dollars for nothing ! Started my trip June 15th. Too late to return it as it proved useless. Do not invest in this . A very unhappy Garmin owner. Pat Mahon
customer_reviews.author: pat

customer_reviews.title: Initial trial looks good
customer_reviews.text: Didn't get to use this much yet due to the recent pandemic, but did use it coming home from Mississippi to Tennessee. Knew the route well but wanted to see how it worked. All good. Detoured from the route twice using the voice command and driving routes. Easily detoured and either guided you back to the original route or started a new one based on your command
customer_reviews.author: William M. Windham Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Check Your Phone Compatibility Before Buying This Unit
customer_reviews.text: I decided I wanted this particular GPS based on reviews I'd seen from other RV'ers. Apparently I didn't do enough research because now that I have it in hand, I found out that the smart phone link function is not compatible with my Samsung Galaxy S4 phone. The bluetooth function does appear to work, but the smart phone link does not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Got me where I needed to go
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t fully tested as I didn’t drive in areas where an rv couldn’t fit. So not sure if it will prevent that or not. I did drive a different way than was directed to test rerouting. Kept wanting me to get back on freeway that was out of the way instead of taking me the faster direction. I would also have liked more screen info displayed instead of cycling though the different items. Not safe to do that while driving.
customer_reviews.author: Big Pete

customer_reviews.title: Not safe!
customer_reviews.text: This product is very poor. We will be going along the interstate highway and it tells us we are going the wrong way. It also kept trying to route us on the outer roads or service roads along the interstate. We put in our rig size and set it up as we thought was correct. My husband is a technical type person who can figure out most electronics but this one is going back. Very dangerous we feel. We have had other Garmin product in years past and loved them. Not the case with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent if you don't drive your RV.
customer_reviews.text: Whatever its other merits, this device is mediocre at best solely for the poor mount, and poorer alternative options. The spring-clip and suction cup mount supplied won't last a mile on the average US interstate highway. Aftermarket cradles simply don't fit (not even close), and Garmin offers absurd options like stuffing it in a cup-holder, which in most Class A's will locate it conveniently on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S.

customer_reviews.title: Great RV GPS
customer_reviews.text: Great GPS. There is a little bit of a learning curve as I had never had a GPS. I had always used google maps before hitting the east coast this summer but we seem to be figuring it out. It tells you when a low bridge is coming up, whether or not the road is good for rv's or if they are an unknown. The only problem I had was with voice recognition. It just would not pick up the address and even state I was giving it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Just 5 minutes of using and you’ll know why it’s the industry’s leader.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Good RV GPS
customer_reviews.text: Great GPS and worked well so far. I input my RV's perimeters, including height and on our recent trip to Galveston, it worked well. However, the system did not warn us that Highway 290, a major freeway, was shut down completely. Not sure why.
customer_reviews.author: Captain ET

customer_reviews.title: its cool entering the gvw and size of my rv
customer_reviews.text: it is larger than the unit i use for my car but i guess using it in an rv requires a larger unit. the updating using my computor went without a hitch. its cool entering the gvw and size of my rv. can't wait to take it on the road and see how it routes me
customer_reviews.author: leslie chun

customer_reviews.title: So-So GPS
customer_reviews.text: Being a pilot I own a Garmin 396 and could not be happier. This unit as well as most ground use GPS's you still have to be vigilant on following directions. I caught this thing on several occasions trying to challenge me. I like the touch screen and the travel features. I like it....Suggest comparing to Magellan or other units you'll probably get same results from others as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Comeaux

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the voice activation. Display is great—very bright. Good for RV routing. Could use a longer power cord for where I have it mounted. I recommend this GPS for Recreational Vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha Wiesehan

customer_reviews.title: Quit working
customer_reviews.text: we had this unit since May 2019 and have used it approximately 4 times. 06/2020 ...unit won't come on we've charged the unit with the original cords to several charging units to no avail it appears that it's not a battery issue. it's DOA . i like the thought of what the unit can provide but, if it lasts 13 months its not long enough for a new $350.00 unit to last. and whats even worse is im finding out that i am 30 days past my return window......that sucks...
customer_reviews.author: Melvin Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Good investment
customer_reviews.text: Have used this for about a week with the RV trailer and without it, the ability to customize and switch vehicle type is convenient. Love the alerts for speed and road hazards as well as upcoming points of interest which you can choose to show. I think this was a solid investment for the ability to route me based on the dimensions of the rv.
customer_reviews.author: YDT_PHOTO1

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Got the unit all set up for my vehicle and trailer. Set up was pretty straight forward. Got it on the road and it notified me of the speed limit in Calif. when towing. Switching out of RV mode was a snap. The area I was testing in I know very well. It wanted to take me a different route even though I knew better, so minus one point for accuracy. I charged it up before i hit the road, but only lasted 50 minutes before shutting off. The touch screen is good, but easy to tap the wrong button. Overall I am satisfied with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Silicon Valley Pete

customer_reviews.title: So far it works pretty good. However
customer_reviews.text: So far it works pretty good. However, is doesn't recognize secondary roads too well. The two trips we've made in a car as an experiment and one in the Class A motor home were good, but the real test will be in Spring 2018 for a month long excursion and I will update my evaluation afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Smith sr

customer_reviews.title: Makes your towing experience easy and less stressful
customer_reviews.text: Must have for RV’s and travel trailers. Makes your towing experience easy and less stressful. Ensures you never get stuck by keeping your long load off those roads/bridges that can’t accommodate your length. Love it because it tells you what lane to be in which helps you avoid last minute lane changes. I never tow without it! Thanks Garmin!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: got us from point A to B ...
customer_reviews.text: The battery life when not plugged in is a joke on ours. Voice commands are cumbersome they work but not well. The chargers provided are annoying needs a wall unit also so I don’t have to sit in the truck to build a route or have decent battery!! The GPS got us where we wanted to go which were places we had never been so that was good. The route builder is neat, Being able to add hairy RV specs is good but with today’s tech and a phones capabilities just seems if you buy a unit for a specific task it would be solid at that task including the bells and whistles it claims to have.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was up to date on the maps as my wife's phone.
customer_reviews.text: I updated the maps, but it didn't work as good as my wife's GPS on her phone. Some of the places were not updated where we traveled. The touch screen worked sometime and other times it didn't work well. I may have got a bad one. I like all the tweets it had. It started telling us when unsurpassed were then it stopped.
customer_reviews.author: kightrider52

customer_reviews.title: Be careful using this with a RV or truck.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't take you the safest way. It goes miles out of the way. In RV mode takes u on low bridge roads, very narrow Rds, just wasn't what I thought it would do. I'm very disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what you need for your motorhome.
customer_reviews.text: This GPS was a wonderful addition to my class C motorhome. As I travel I am somewhat concerned about bridge heights. The GPS allows me to enter the information on my motorhome. It keeps me safe as I drive down the road. I have not used all of its features. Someday I will. This is my third GPS I always purchase Garmin
customer_reviews.author: Bob K

customer_reviews.title: Poor routing
customer_reviews.text: Mapped to a Koa close to Mount rushmore. Took us to a dead end private road. Had to unhook the toad and figure out how to turn the RV around. Repeatedly took us down busy city streets.
customer_reviews.author: David Hauschel

customer_reviews.title: Great for RV
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my trip out west and back Home to Western North Caroling. I traveled to Mount Rushmore, Yellowstone National Park, down to Zion Canyon, then over to Bryce Canyon , and then back up to Denver Colorado and back Home to Western North Carolina with no problems. Its easy to read and navigate. Provides lots of information and traffic updates.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This GPS is awesome. It is very fast and the touch screen is as good as your I phone. it was very easy to find campgrounds buy city and state. I also really like that you can change the route if you want to travel on a certain road. I have owned 3 other GPS systems and this one is by far the best Ive used
customer_reviews.author: Jim reling

customer_reviews.title: Perfect RV GPS!
customer_reviews.text: Prefer for our RV! It was simple to set up and every day I learn something new about the unit and what it can do!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Monti

customer_reviews.title: Great RV product
customer_reviews.text: A must have for anyone traveling in an RV. On a year of travel it has never taken us somewhere our RV shouldn't be. Easy to use, though it has a little trouble finding some addresses. Probably needs the software updated.
customer_reviews.author: Tool Man

customer_reviews.title: Garmin 770
customer_reviews.text: So far has met most of my expectations. From my house it wants to take me 100yrs out of the way just to double back on the other side of the road rather than simply crossing the street. There are no obstructions or reasons to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Morrow

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Every time I put an address or an rv park it always comes up can't be found. Then one time I put in to avoid tolls and it wanted me to go 600 miles out of the way into Canada and back down. So far not happy with it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Calvitto

customer_reviews.title: bad directions
customer_reviews.text: cant find cities near you,sends you way off route,i would go with a cheaper one not for trucks and RVs
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Clancy

customer_reviews.title: I like this Garmin GPS for my motorhome
customer_reviews.text: I like this. Trip planner/router. Warnings for curves, speed changes, over speed limit, avoiding dead-end or non-recommended situations for my motorhome's length, width, weight. So far very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: kc1tom

customer_reviews.title: Garmin RV 770 NA LMT-S
customer_reviews.text: SO FAR I USED IT FOR A TRIP FROM LONG ISLAND TO PENNSYLVANIA AND BACK AND IT PERFORMED AWESOMELY
customer_reviews.author: JAMES

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great GPS, just be sure to follow all of the setup instructions carefully!
customer_reviews.author: SMPerry

customer_reviews.title: More route options
customer_reviews.text: Works good Needs to have a routing option more choices Shortest route,fastest route But also needs (best road) option
customer_reviews.author: Eli A Miller

customer_reviews.title: Could be more accurate with fewer errors
customer_reviews.text: Bought this GPS for use in my RV. Given the cost of this item I am somewhat disappointed. On a three thousand mile trip it made multiple errors. Moreover, the voice recognition left much to be desired. It failed to understand addresses on multiple occasions.
customer_reviews.author: Flarider

customer_reviews.title: Nice big Screen
customer_reviews.text: So far the system seems to work ok. We have not used it very much to be able to give accurate review. We will test it more in the future but we don’t get to travel as much as we would like to.
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: Swing and a misssssss
customer_reviews.text: Bluetooth keeps dropping out, Not good for phone calls constant clicking noise, Seems like it dose not like an I phone 7, Traffic updates not working.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: GET LOST GARMIN
customer_reviews.text: Still take me to all the wrong places. Takes for ever to update. I like it do to the size it is EZ to read and I like the info it displays I just do not follow it blindly.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Total Fail
customer_reviews.text: GPS accuracy is so bad that it is useless if you are within a 50 ft of another road. It has some features that I like but during a 5860 mile 19 day trip around the US it never worked a single time to guide us to our campsite. Had to rely of Google Maps.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Vrieling

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: We were returning home today and knew of a campground we had googled and wanted to stay at. The Garmin could not find it under the campground listing or the address. Google maps had no problem! Really upset I spent this much for a disappointing device!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy B.

customer_reviews.title: Love this GPS
customer_reviews.text: Love this new GPS. I especially like the hands free option Setup was very easy and the screen is bright and large enough to see.
customer_reviews.author: DougR

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: This has been great for travel in our RV. Easy to use and eases stress of taking the wrong road for the size of an RV.
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: So far So Good
customer_reviews.text: So far it has worked great. But we are getting ready to go on a long road trip will see how it works on a long trip.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnie smoke

customer_reviews.title: Time saver.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well with the travel trailer with avoiding low overpasses and narrow roads.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase  unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Had to disconnect our towed vehicle twice, due to errors. Recently got us within 3 miles of where we knew we were going, and sent us 6 miles out of the way with bridge restrictons. One regular destination is never correct, if we followed it, we would go in a constant circle 3 miles from destination. Says it is up to date, but fails us almkst every trip. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Eddy

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised!!!
customer_reviews.text: Item arrive super quick. Item is not accurate as it does not give commercial routes for hauling things . Called tech support at Garmin and they informed me they are having problems with this model and the newer version since it uses the same maps. They are gonna try a map update or a software update which may take a couple of weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Voice command is very poor.
customer_reviews.text: Voice command rarely works properly. Does not show actual miles. It only shows segments.
customer_reviews.author: Donald F. Rae

customer_reviews.title: Great TV gps
customer_reviews.text: Far superior to rand McNally's I have. Lacks some map details on map compared to other Garmin's I have. Large screen
customer_reviews.author: gordon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Big screen, easy to use program it according to what your driving or towing
customer_reviews.author: eric ong

customer_reviews.title: Routed us to a road closure.
customer_reviews.text: I would return this but I’m a few days beyond the return window. I bought this Garmin because I’m pulling a 25’ travel trailer. Outside of Columbus, Ohio, the Garmin routed us to a road closure. It seems to be out of date technology.
customer_reviews.author: Penelope A. McCrea

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Got for my parents. They love the large screen. Product is so easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get the warranty
customer_reviews.text: First on I bought only worked a little over a year. Bought another and got the warranty. Jury is still out on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Critical Tom

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver
customer_reviews.text: Great product for large vehicles like RVs or Semis. It saved me many times from taking roads to small for my RV to go down.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Updates directly without need for computer.
customer_reviews.text: Like the feature of updating direct from Internet without need for using a computer.q
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big size and bright colors.
customer_reviews.text: Like big size. Bright and clear. Like voice commands. Don’t like how hard it is to just find an address far away.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Koster Crawford

customer_reviews.title: No issues.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived without issue. Probably won't get used until for any long trips right away, but it functioned without issue so far.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Harried

customer_reviews.title: A lot of detailed setup options
customer_reviews.text: Overall, great product. On screen menus could be a bit more intuitive. Large, clear display, great audio, and lots of features,
customer_reviews.author: Art G

customer_reviews.title: This model has several flaws.  Love all other Garmin's that I own.
customer_reviews.text: I have several Garmin's and I love them, except this model. This model has a shiny screen and I could not see the screen in the daylight. Also, this model does not have a rim around it, so when you pick it up or barely touch it the screen changes immediately. Very irritating.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Kaufman

customer_reviews.title: No instructions,  just have to get in and do it.
customer_reviews.text: Have all my trip legs set and ready to go. Had to tinker with the programming a bit but got everything put in. See how it performs on the road next week.
customer_reviews.author: Craig F.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy. Unit is helpful.
customer_reviews.text: The trips with this have been uneventful thus far. So it's seams to be doing it's job. :)
customer_reviews.author: Blackhawk50

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Large screen and extra features (railroads/Red Light Cameras).
customer_reviews.author: Donald C  Bork

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to use. When in a motor home does not always use the shortest route and will take you miles out of your way. Seems to work fine in car mode.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Rithmamn

customer_reviews.title: Great advance allerts
customer_reviews.text: The speed limit change alerts whenever a change is approaching is very helpful along with the alerts for railroad tracks, school zones and sharp curves. It makes driving strange roads much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Calif Seal

customer_reviews.title: good screen for viewing road
customer_reviews.text: This Garmin has many updated features from our old one. The screen is obviously larger, better graphics, and we like the split screen when coming up to changing lanes from one freeway to another. Overall it does its job well.
customer_reviews.author: Handyman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed Loyal Garmin user
customer_reviews.text: This is awful! Why do you say traffic but if you don't have a smart phone, it is worthless!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa - MA

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's ok but will give you some stupid directions when you know where you're going.
customer_reviews.author: mjpomante

customer_reviews.title: Best deal going for an RV GPS.
customer_reviews.text: Best deal going for an RV GPS. But, still needs some improvements.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Power issue not fixed, even with new unit provided by Garmin
customer_reviews.text: First device would not charge. Replaced by Garmin. Same problems. Won't charge in either USB or cigarette lighter. Dies within 15 minutes after being charged for two days. Have tried multiple chargers, multiple outlets.
customer_reviews.author: Gail A McMonagle

customer_reviews.title: Great if you driving RV 's
customer_reviews.text: Like the larger screen, update over wifi instead of hooking up to computer. School zones warning and curve ahead. Answering phone over GPS unit a nice touch. Happy with the unit especially using it with RV
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Rosenberger

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: got me to where I wanted to go, I felt it could have gone a shorter way.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Garmin
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned a ton of Garmin products over the years and this does not disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: denali830

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed with this GPS
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed with this. I actually went out and bought a Rand McNally. This “lost satellite constantly. It was so bad i had to use my cell phone. Since i drive a 40’ motorhome that is dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: The Sports Zone owner

customer_reviews.title: RV Comment
customer_reviews.text: I like the speed of loading the maps. The overall physical construction has gotten pretty cheap. I haven't given it a good road test yet
customer_reviews.author: Lynnie

customer_reviews.title: Not the best!
customer_reviews.text: Having problems with some city directions, does not have a way to track fuel and milage, but seems to work ok.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M Parks

product_meta.title: Garmin RV 770 NA LMT-S, Advanced Navigation for RVs and Towable Trailers, Directory of RV Parks & Services, Voice-Activated Navigation
product_meta.description: Style:SingleRV 770 LMT-S is an easy-to-see navigator with a 6.95” edge-to-edge touchscreen and RV-specific features, including road warnings and custom routing for the size and weight of your RV or trailer. A directory of RV Parks & Services finds sites with your preferred amenities. Includes free live traffic, basic weather forecasts and more (requires Smartphone Link app). RV 770 LMT-S is preloaded with TripAdvisor travel points of interest such as popular restaurants and attractions. Use built-in Wi-Fi for easy map and software updates when you’re on the road. The LiveTrack feature lets you share your location so friends can track your journey. Convenient hands-free features include Bluetooth hands-free calling, voice-activated navigation and more. Display type : multi-touch, glass, WSVGA color TFT with white backlight
feature_bullets: Large, high-resolution, 6.95” edge-to-edge display is easy to see while navigating the open road
Custom RV routing based on size and weight of your RV or towable trailer. Hands-free features include Bluetooth calling³, smart notifications5 and voice-activated navigation
Access free live traffic, basic weather and more - simply download the free Smartphone Link app to your compatible smartphone
Learn of suggested attractions along your route to make the journey more interesting and fun. Display resolution 1024 x 600 pixels
Built-in Wi-Fi connectivity for easy map and software updates when you’re on the road; no computer needed!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars675 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: USB cable, Vehicle suction cup mount, Quick start manual, RV 770, Vehicle power cable
